page.title: 16THE CORONATION HALL
page.content: Originally the people of Whitbourne had{meetings}and plays in a small hut which belonged to ex_servicemen.As the village grew,this became too small.It was also old and unsafe for large gatherings so it was decided that a {new hall}should be built which would belong to the villagers.A committee was formed and{fund raising events took place.These included an ox_roast, dances,fetes,whist drives and raffles.The cast of The Archers came to the village and sold autographs. Eventuallyenough money was raised for an architect to be employed and building began. The hall was opened in 1954 and was named The Coronation Hall since Queen Elizabeth 11 had just been crowned. The hall was equipped with chairs,tables,crockery and cutlery and is now used by most of the clubs and
